title: China-USA/One China
content:
Chinese President Xi Jinping and U.S. president Barack Obama's reiteration of stand on the Taiwan issue helps strengthen the one-China policy internationally, a spokesperson for the Taiwan Affairs Office of Chinese State Council said on Tuesday at a press briefing. 

Chinese President Xi Jinping had a discussion with U.S. President Barack Obama on the Taiwan issue in Washington D.C., Ma Xiaoguang, the spokesman, said. 

Xi stressed that China is highly sensitive on the issues related to Chinese sovereignty and territorial integrity, and hopes the U.S. side would adhere to its relevant commitment and not support any kinds of behaviors harmful to Chinese reunification and stabilization, Ma dded. 

Obama restated that the U.S. upholds the one-China policy and sticks to the principles of the three China-U.S. joint communiques, stressing the U.S. will not change the stand and will not support the "independence of Taiwan", Ma said. 

"Chinese and U.S. leaders' reiteration of the attitude towards the Taiwan issue helps the international community strengthen the one-China policy, implement the one-China policy and deal with issues related to Taiwan according to the one-China principle. There is no room for any activities of 'Taiwan independence'. China will not allow the 'Taiwan independence' force to destroy and split the Chinese sovereignty and territorial integrity in any form. This is the most important thing," said Ma Xiaoguang.
